title: Monthly consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in India July 2019
summary: This grouped bar chart represents Consumer price index on the Y-axis. And, its value throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural.
All through the Months, similar trend was observed for Urban and All India. In both cases, the Consumer price index have risen.
Out of all 3 groups, Rural had the highest Consumer price index in Month June and Urban had the lowest Consumer price index in Month January.
In Month June, Urban had the highest Consumer price index among all 6 Months and it has the lowest Consumer price index in Month January.
min_summary: This is a grouped bar chart showing Consumer price index on the Y-axis throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural on the X-axis.
All through the Months, similar trend was observed for Urban and All India. In both cases, the Consumer price index have risen.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents Consumer price index on the Y-axis. And, its value throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural.
All through the Months, similar trend was observed for Urban and All India. In both cases, the Consumer price index have risen.
Out of all 3 groups, Rural had the highest Consumer price index in Month June and Urban had the lowest Consumer price index in Month January.
In Month June, Urban had the highest Consumer price index among all 6 Months and it has the lowest Consumer price index in Month January.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents Consumer price index on the Y-axis. And, how the value changed throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural.
Over the 6 Months, the Consumer price index for both Urban and All India have risen.
Out of all 3 groups, Rural had the highest Consumer price index in Month June and Urban had the lowest Consumer price index in Month January.
In Month June, Urban had the highest Consumer price index among all 6 Months and it has the lowest Consumer price index in Month January.
Month June and January had the biggest gap of 41.0 between the highest and lowest Consumer price index found for Urban.
Out of all 3 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Consumer price index was found in case of Urban.

In Month June, Rural had the highest Consumer price index 1436.0 among the 3 groups and in January, Urban had the lowest Consumer price index 1380.0. The second highest Consumer price index 1429.0 was observed for Rural in Month June.
On average, the Month June had the highest Consumer price index for all 3 groups All India, Urban, and Rural. Whereas January had the lowest average Consumer price index.
